title: Odd and even photon-subtracted two-mode squeezed vacuum states
authors: Ananga Mohan Datta and Kurt Busch and Armando Perez-Leija
abstract:
Photon-subtracted two-mode squeezed vacuum states, a significant quantum
resource, exhibit intricate correlations and unique quantum properties. In this
work, we propose a theoretical yet experimentally feasible model to engineer
these states using a waveguide trimer. Our study uncovers distinct
characteristics of the photon-subtracted state depending on whether an even or
odd number of photons is extracted, shedding light on the subtle relationship
between quantum state manipulation and the parity of the number of subtracted
photons. Furthermore, our integrated device facilitates the generation of
multiphoton states with tunable correlations, offering significant potential
for applications in quantum-enhanced technologies.
